revised_title: Deep-Sea Echinoderms: Discoveries from the Dredging Expeditions
tldr: The author discusses the findings from deep-sea dredging expeditions, focusing on the Echinoderms, specifically Echinoidea, discovered in the North Atlantic. These deep-sea creatures were found in extreme depths, with some species being abundant even at 2000 fathoms. The author also describes the physical characteristics and classifications of these echinoderms, as well as their relation to extinct species from the Cretaceous and Tertiary periods.
